comments.author: Pocketchange
comments.body: 25/10/22https://cointelegraph.com/news/cashapp-adds-support-for-bitcoin-lightning-networkCashApp adds support for Bitcoin Lightning NetworkThere is a limit of $999 every seven days for BTC transactions on the Lightning Network.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: For now it is allegedly only available for those who reside in the United States (except those from the State of New York).I have never used this app, actually, I do not recall ever hearing about it here in my country, but whatever implementation of the second layer which helps people to move their money, it is welcomed.

comments.author: n0ne
comments.body: Quote from: Hispo on February 18, 2023, 01:54:34 AMFor now it is allegedly only available for those who reside in the United States (except those from the State of New York).I have never used this app, actually, I do not recall ever hearing about it here in my country, but whatever implementation of the second layer which helps people to move their money, it is welcomed.Already Cash App isn't available all around the world. The service is limited within the United States and United Kingdom. This being a popular application to buy bitcoin makes the addition of lightning network an added feature. Already they've got 1.5% on instant transaction. Maybe this service could come at a better transaction fee. The access to international transaction need to be added and the same might be beneficial with the lightning network.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Quote from: n0ne on February 18, 2023, 02:44:11 AMAlready they've got 1.5% on instant transaction. Maybe this service could come at a better transaction fee. The access to international transaction need to be added and the same might be beneficial with the lightning network.There's no need Cash App should be available all around the world in order to adopt lighting network, moreover as you said Cash App do ask extra fees and it's a centralized payment provider where it's not good if you plan to hold your Bitcoin for long time. We already have a lot wallets support lightning network e.g. Electrum, Blue wallet, Zap wallet etc and there are a lot exchanges support too [1].It just a benefit for Cash App if they have a plan to accept countries outside United States, but it's not give huge impact to lightning network adoption. There's also a limit which has been mentioned by above user, no way to use it.[1] https://github.com/theDavidCoen/LightningExchanges
